title: sokani
author: sokani
created_time: September 10, 2023, 03:56:59 PMLast edit: September 10, 2023, 09:06:06 PM by sokani
content: Hackers dey very smart and dem dey up their game everyday. Di latest right now na di one wey happen through di account of Ethereum founder Vitalik Buterin and na wetin dey trend right now for di crypto space. Di tori be say an attacker gained access into Vitalik X (Twitter) account, come post phishing link say make people connect their wallet in other to claim a free NFT. People wey rush connect their wallets na dem suffer dis loss and so far di hacker don drain about $691k worth of digital assets from dis affected wallets. Di tweet has been taken down and e be like say X team don recover di account.Nothing dey free for freetown, make we dey always exercise caution and know di way we dey click links.Make we no authorize third party apps access to wallet wia we get plenty funds or wallet wia we dey use save funds. Di attack dey really convincing because people think say na Vitalik share di link, so if you be di type wey like free things, make you get one empty wallet for airdrops or freebies and after you don confirm say di collection dey legit, you fit move am to a particular destination wallet.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Despite that Twitter users can use 2FA app like Aegis or Security key as an extra layer of protecting their Twitter account, these people do not care about their users. Twitter hack account scam like this is common and no more new. I hope this will help newbies to avoid this type of scam.

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: Carelessness and greediness nai dey cause this loss. Hackers dey find all means to scam people in the world so dem dey bring new new things to scam people so because of dat we need to be careful with our doings online if not we go hear say dem don collect everything from us. I piti those who go clicked di link and connect their wallets to collect free coins. I think say Twitter dem dey secure because me I no dey use Twitter because I no like am.  And dis one wey dem go use Vitalik Buterin account scam people, how im wan take explain to them say no am, im go explain tire no evidence  . Op thanks you for di information we go use am guide ourselves. Make no dey click links anyhow. Don't find money like that, and be content of what you have. Because of all this finding of money dey make some people dey loss money again. Me I don tok am say e go go hard for scammers go scam me again because me I don enter their traps well well so I know dem very. Any link I see in my message box, email social media handles I dey delete am in sharp without delay. I no won hear di story that touches the heart. Make we dey be careful abeg. Hackers dey everywhere. Your house, home, offices and shops. Friends and relatives they are all suspects. Your wife can hack you.

comments.author: Sim_card
comments.body: Imagine you wey get that kind big money still dey find free NFT, na wa o. Why he be say upon the one wey we get we no go dey satisfied. See as those scammers send malicious link for am wey them us drain him wallet. This should be a lesson to us that we should be satisfied with what we have because free something dey purge belle. Anybody wey you meet online wey say na free service him dey offer, make you run from such people because they are not far from scamming you. OP,he good as you bring up this thread here for a reminder to us and especially the newbies for them to also learn from am too. Wetin i see about these hackers no matter any app wey you use as long as you fall for their trap, you must be their victim.

comments.author: Igebotz
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on September 10, 2023, 04:00:39 PMDespite that Twitter users can use 2FA app like Aegis or Security key as an extra layer of protecting their Twitter account, these people do not care about their users. Twitter hack account scam like this is common and no more new. I hope this will help newbies to avoid this type of scam.What if he hadn't actually been hacked out of his account?  What if he's the one behind this? trust no one on the interment, bro. It's difficult to think that a man who built one of the most secure blockchains couldn't keep his X account safe from hackers. X has 2FA choices, but with sim swaps occurring all over the world, this option is vulnerable to hackers. The simplest method to prevent this is for x to implement hardware 2FA. Keep an eye out for danger and don't believe everything you see on the internet.Hardware 2FA

comments.author: nelson4lov
comments.body: Quote from: Igebotz on September 10, 2023, 10:25:50 PMQuote from: Charles-Tim on September 10, 2023, 04:00:39 PMDespite that Twitter users can use 2FA app like Aegis or Security key as an extra layer of protecting their Twitter account, these people do not care about their users. Twitter hack account scam like this is common and no more new. I hope this will help newbies to avoid this type of scam.What if he hadn't actually been hacked out of his account?  What if he's the one behind this? trust no one on the interment, bro. It's difficult to think that a man who built one of the most secure blockchains couldn't keep his X account safe from hackers. X has 2FA choices, but with sim swaps occurring all over the world, this option is vulnerable to hackers. The simplest method to prevent this is for x to implement hardware 2FA. Keep an eye out for danger and don't believe everything you see on the internet.Hardware 2FASince X doesn't offer support for hardware 2FA yet, I suggest  using the good old authenticator apps like Authy but the "Allow multi device" option needs to be turned off so even if hackers get access to the sim sms via sim swap, they still won't be able to access the Authenticator. This ia just am interim solution anyway plus the SMS option for 2FA should be turned off across all sites.

Already Vitalik no be dat kind man to dey post airdrop, the guy no dey do dat kind thing Na just greediness they curse all this things because we get similar cases in the past wey giveaway were been announced on celebrities accounts and people's fall for am wey dem scam many people. This one no different so why people come dey believe all this things. Twitter (X) na one of the most targeted platforms by hackers because dem know say the platform get plenty way wey you go fit take hack am as na home of bots (after telegram) and plenty API  software too full the platform so it's liable to hacks. Quote from: sokani on September 10, 2023, 03:56:59 PMNothing dey free for freetown, make we dey always exercise caution and know di way we dey click links. Make we no authorize third party apps access to wallet wia we get plenty funds or wallet wia we dey use save funds.Dem go gree hear, wetin dey there to get different wallets for different purposed. You see eh any wallet wey you dey use for holding supposed no be ur active wallets. Trading wallets supposed dey and airdrop wallets too suppose dey. You supposed differentiate your investment from your hustling wallets so incase this kind thing happened for future e no go affect you. Make I say you use the airdrop wallets and get some free valuable NFT or any tokens wey you dey chase after, you fit come transfer am to your trading wallet if you wan sell or holding wallet if you wan hold am for something. Make we no make this mistakes as scams dey everywhere and you no go know which one be scam until e happen.
